issue.title: Bug: Dialog crash on Electron v31.x

repository.name: custom-electron-prompt
repository.description: Custom prompt for electron made easy with various templates

issue.body:
This package works well on any version of Electron <= v30.3.0, however, when migrating over to Electron v31, clicking the close button in the top-right of the custom prompt dialog, the entire app itself will crash. If you utilize a button at the bottom of the prompt window to close it, it works fine, but that top-right button kills the app immediately and the process hangs in the background until killed by the task manager. Created a fresh app with the following, and the bug exists there too: ```json "dependencies": { "custom-electron-prompt": "^1.5.7", "electron": "^31.0.0", } ```
### Works ![dmNefWORy3](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/47e09e3e-227e-448a-b5b9-9c12bf4c7efa)
### Crashes ![IWVXNVXGNQ](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/d17fc1b7-401e-469b-b78a-4f77f552401c)
---
### Electron v30 ![Jtf6AOymwK](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/93aca429-06c0-4c9f-a91b-aef142fd29d5)
### Electron v31 ![IVXXylX3o7](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/f5a2c143-edde-4d88-9aef-80e7b454f0d4)
---
This is on Windows 11 Pro. Have not tested on Linux yet. Type of prompt doesn't matter either, have tested using `multiInput` and `input`

issue.title: v1.5.8

repository.name: custom-electron-prompt
repository.description: Custom prompt for electron made easy with various templates

issue.body:
fix #26

see also https://github.com/electron/electron/issues/42975

This PR also change the package manager to Bun, and replace the deprecated Rome with Biome

issue.title: Native notification support for Windows

repository.name: ntfy-electron
repository.description: Electron wrapper for the ntfy web app

issue.body:
Thus far, the app is great.

Only question is if this app has the ability to send push notifications to the host computer (Windows).

I closed out the browser window which was how I received notifications to Windows, and this app seems to only show them if I open the app and view the interface. No notifications are ever pushed to the Windows notification system.

I read someone else asking about this as well, so I figured I'd ask to see if it's possible / already integrated.

issue.title: fix: crash when iterating all windows

labels.name: target/31-x-y
labels.description: PR should also be added to the "31-x-y" branch.

labels.name: target/32-x-y
labels.description: PR should also be added to the "32-x-y" branch.

repository.name: electron
repository.description: :electron: Build cross-platform desktop apps with JavaScript, HTML, and CSS

issue.body:
#### Description of Change

Closes https://github.com/electron/electron/issues/42975.
Refs https://github.com/electron/electron/pull/41326.

It's still possible that native code might be iterating all windows when the BaseWindow destructor is called, leading to a crash. We still need to have this `window_.release()` call delayed to the next tick to handle this.

#### Checklist
<!-- Remove items that do not apply. For completed items, change [ ] to [x]. -->

- [x] PR description included and stakeholders cc'd
- [x] `npm test` passes
- [x] [PR release notes](https://github.com/electron/clerk/blob/main/README.md) describe the change in a way relevant to app developers, and are [capitalized, punctuated, and past tense](https://github.com/electron/clerk/blob/main/README.md#examples).

#### Release Notes

Notes: Fixed a potential crash when calling `BrowserWindow.destroy()`

body:
> Closed by https://github.com/electron/electron/pull/43033

It says the PR is for MacOS but this issue was reported on Windows?

issue.title: refactor: remove InspectableWebContentsViewMac in favor of the Views version

labels.name: merged/35-x-y
labels.description: PR was merged to the "35-x-y" branch.

repository.name: electron
repository.description: :electron: Build cross-platform desktop apps with JavaScript, HTML, and CSS

issue.body:
#### Description of Change

This is the re-land of #41326 with fixes for the issues which enforced revert of the refactor.

For ease of review first commit is a cherry-pick of original change e67ab9a93dadccecff30de50ab4555191c30b6c4 without fixing conflicts and build issues. Second commit resolves these conflicts and fixes building Electron. Further commits are fixes for following issues which caused revert:
Fixes #42995 
Fixes #43010
Fixes #43003 
Fixes #42336 
Fixes #42335 
Fixes #42975 

#### Checklist
<!-- Remove items that do not apply. For completed items, change [ ] to [x]. -->

- [x] PR description included and stakeholders cc'd
- [x] `npm test` passes

#### Release Notes

Notes: none
